groups.treatment: Spaceflight in microgravity for 38 days on the International Space Station (ISS), followed by Live Animal Return (LAR) to Earth.
groups.results: Tissue samples from right extensor digitorum longus muscle were collected post-flight, preserved in liquid nitrogen, and stored at -80Â°C for RNA extraction and sequencing.

groups.treatment: Ground control kept in the same habitat conditions as the flight group, but without spaceflight.
groups.results: Tissue samples were collected in parallel to the flight group under similar post-flight conditions.

groups.treatment: Standard vivarium housing without exposure to habitat controls or spaceflight conditions.
groups.results: Tissue samples were collected under normal ground conditions for comparison with flight and habitat control groups.

pre_launch_events.event: Mice loaded into the Transporter for launch.
Launch of SpaceX-21 with mice onboard.
Mice transferred to Rodent Habitats upon arrival at ISS.

post_return_events.event: Flight mice splashdown in Atlantic Ocean.
Mice transported to Texas A&M University for post-flight procedures.
Flight and Ground Control animals euthanized and dissected for tissue collection.

osdr_experiments.description: GeneLab RNA sequencing study of right extensor digitorum longus muscle from flight and ground control mice.

same_subject_experiments.description: Rodent Research-23 mission focused on understanding the effects of spaceflight on the eyes, with tissue samples taken from various organs for analysis.
